docs.lead_paragraph: Each year 230,000 to 400,000 people are sent to emergency rooms because of lawn mowing accidents, with the majority of injuries occurring in the eyes, the American Academy of Ophthalmology reports. People using lawn mowers can suffer a range of eye injuries, from mild corneal abrasions to retinal detachment, a significant trauma to the eye that can lead to blindness, the academy says. These injuries are usually caused by fragments of rocks or twigs thrown from the mowers.

headline.main: Eyes at Risk, as the Blades Whirl
